sentences.sContent: Put the eggs in the centre of the dish, with the vegetables and herbs around the edge.
sentences.sCn: 把鸡蛋放在盘子中间，盘边一圈放些蔬菜和香草。

sentences.sContent: He stood at the water’s edge staring across the lake.
sentences.sCn: 他站在水边，凝视着湖对面。

sentences.sContent: A leaf was on the ground, curling up at the edges.
sentences.sCn: 地上有一片叶子，叶边卷曲着。

sentences.sContent: ...There’s part of this sickening horror of knowing you’re walking on the edge with this...
...That seems at the outer edge of restrictive...
...ZEH communities are the leading edge of technologies that might someday create houses that produce as much energy as they consume...
...What did Mclaughlin do on June 7th near the edge of the company’s parking lot...
...Mclaughlin once again demonstrated his carelessness by knocking down several mail boxes near the edge of the company’s parking lot...
...She was an office manager whose company has just moved into the new office park on the edge of town...

phrases.pCn: 前沿；居领先优势；最先着风的帆缘
直尺，平尺；校正装置，直棱

words.tran: 急躁的；尖利的；刀口锐利的
使开刃；加边于；侧着移动（edge的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: the part of an object that is furthest from its centre
